arm_group.description: Only epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) M+ patients will be eligible for the study assessments

brief_summary.textblock:
The present study has been designed in order to characterize the incidence of patients with
      advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) carrying epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR)
      positive mutations and their clinical management in Galicia.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study to Characterize the Incidence of EGFR Mutation Positive and Advanced NSCLC Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Inclusion Criteria for patients´ screening:

          -  Patients of both sexes aged 18 or more.

          -  Histologically confirmed advanced or metastatic Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
             (patients stage III B unsuitable for locoregional treatment, and stage IV).

          -  Chemo- naïve patients (Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancer patients who have not received
             first line systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy).

          -  Patients with available tumoral tissue (primary tumor or metastatic area) or
             cytological samples including fine needle aspirates (primary tumor or metastatic
             area), bronchial alveolar lavage or bronchial scrapings and pleural effusion.

          -  Patients who have granted their written informed consent.

        Patients must fulfill the inclusion criteria previously mentioned and the following one in
        order to be enrolled in the study (visit 1) for the follow-up until progression or until 9
        months from the beginning of treatment have elapsed:

        Inclusion Criteria for patients´ follow-up

          -  Patients with documented positive mutation in epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR)
             (M+).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Combined histology of non-small cell and small cell lung cancer.

keyword: Epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) positive mutation

facility.name: Hospital Clínico Universitario de Santiago de Compostela

clinical_study.official_title: Observational Post-authorization Prospective Study to Characterize the Incidence of Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Mutation Positive and Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Patients and Their Clinical Management in Galicia

overall_official.affiliation: Grupo Gallego de Cáncer de Pulmón (GGCP)

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Agencia Española de Medicamentos y Productos Sanitarios

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) positive mutation among advanced or metastatic non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) patients in Galicia

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) mutational status in tumor tissue (primary tumor or metastatic samples) and plasma samples at screening
Type of epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) mutations: deletion in exon 19, point mutation at codon 858 (L858R) or other (only for EGFR M+ patients)
Prescribed first line treatment (only for epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) M+ patients)
Tumor response (only for epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) M+ patients)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion until disease progression, death or until 9 months from the inclusion of the last patient in the study have elapsed, whichever is earlier.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease control (only for epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) M+ patients)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion until the end of the study (9 months subsequent to the last patient's inclusion or until lost of follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Prescribed second-line treatment after progression (only for epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) M+ patients)
Progression-free survival and overall survival (only for epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) M+ patients)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day (at the end of the study 9 months subsequent to the last patient's inclusion or until lost of follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) mutational status at disease progression in tumor tissue (primary tumor or metastatic samples) and plasma samples (only for EGFR M+ patients)

clinical_study.source: Grupo Gallego de Cancer de Pulmon

lead_sponsor.agency: Grupo Gallego de Cancer de Pulmon

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
